	&#160;
</DIV>
<EFX_BUSINESS>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;DESCRIPTION OF OUR BUSINESS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Unless stated otherwise, the scientific and technical information in this AIF is solely derived from, and in some instances is an extract from, the Brucejack Report.&#160;&#160;Reference should be made to the full text of the Brucejack Report, which is available electronically on the SEDAR website at www.sedar.com under our SEDAR profile, as the Brucejack Report contains additional assumptions, qualifications, references, reliances and procedures which are not fully described herein.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The &#8220;Resource Estimate&#8221; in the Brucejack Report has been prepared in compliance with NI 43-101 and Form 43-101F1 which require that all estimates be prepared in accordance with the &#8220;CIM Definition Standards on Mineral Resources and Mineral Reserves as prepared by the CIM Standing Committee on Reserve Definitions&#8221; and in effect as of the effective date of the Brucejack Report. The quantity and grade of reported inferred resources in this estimation are uncertain in nature and there has been insufficient exploration to define these inferred resources as an indicated or measured mineral resource and it is uncertain if further exploration will result in upgrading them to an indicated or measured mineral resource category. Mineral resources which are not mineral reserves do not have demonstrated economic viability. The estimate of mineral resources may be materially affected by environmental, permitting, legal, title, taxation, socio-political, marketing, or other relevant issues.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Details of the Brucejack Project
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Project Description and Location
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The Brucejack Project (also known as the &#8220;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Property
</FONT>
	&#8221; in the Brucejack Report) consists of four mining leases and six mineral claims totalling 3,054 hectares.&#160;&#160;The mining leases require annual payments to remain in good standing and the mineral claims are in good standing until January 31, 2026.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The Brucejack Project is centred at approximately latitude 56&#176;28&#8217;20&#8221;N by longitude 130&#176;11&#8217;31&#8221;W, approximately 950 kilometres northwest of Vancouver, 65 kilometres north-northwest of Stewart, and 21 kilometres south-southeast of the Eskay Creek Mine.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We acquired our 100% outright interest in the Brucejack Project in December 2010, pursuant to the Acquisition Agreement with Silver Standard.&#160;&#160;The Brucejack Project is subject to a 1.2% net smelter returns royalty in favour of Franco-Nevada Corporation (&#8220;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Franco-Nevada
</FONT>
	&#8221;) on production in excess of 503,386 ounces of gold and 17,907,080 ounces of silver.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Property Location Map
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/03/29/0001199835-16-000685_PRETIUM16790-FIG1.JPG" ALT="">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Accessibility, Climate, Local Resources, Infrastructure and Physiography
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Accessibility
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The Brucejack Project is located in the Boundary Range of the Coast Mountain Physiographic Belt along the western margin of the Intermontane Tectonic Belt.&#160;&#160;The terrain is generally steep with local reliefs of 1000 metres from valleys occupied by receding glaciers, to ridges at elevations of 1200 metres above sea-level.&#160;&#160;Elevations within the Brucejack Project area range from 1366 metres along Brucejack Lake to 1650 metres at the Bridge Zone.&#160;&#160;However, within several areas, the relief is relatively low to moderate.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	19
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage30"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We have completed construction of our approximately 74 kilometre exploration access road that links the Brucejack Camp to Highway 37 via the Knipple Glacier, Bowser Camp and Wildfire Camp.&#160;&#160;Personnel, equipment, fuel and camp provisions are driven to a staging area on the Knipple Glacier before being taken over the glacier to the Brucejack Camp.&#160;&#160;The area is easily accessible by helicopter from the town of Stewart, or seasonally from the settlement of Bell II.&#160;&#160;The flight time from Stewart is approximately 30 minutes and slightly less from Bell II.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Climate
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The climate is typical of north-western British Columbia with cool, wet summers, and relatively moderate but wet winters.&#160;&#160;Annual temperatures range from +20&#176;C to -20&#176;C.&#160;&#160;Precipitation is high with heavy snowfall accumulations ranging from 10 metres to 15 metres at higher elevations and 2 metres to 3 metres along the lower river valleys.&#160;&#160;Snow packs cover the higher elevations from October to May.&#160;&#160;The optimum field season is from late June to mid-October.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Local Resources and Infrastructure
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	There are no local resources other than abundant water for any drilling work.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The nearest infrastructure is the town of Stewart, approximately 65 kilometres to the south, which has limited supplies and personnel.&#160;&#160;The towns of Terrace and Smithers are also located in the same general region as the Brucejack Project.&#160;&#160;Both are directly accessible by daily air service from Vancouver.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The nearest railway is the Canadian National Railway Yellowhead route, which is located approximately 220 kilometres to the southeast.&#160;&#160;This line runs east-west and terminates at the deep water port of Prince Rupert on the west coast of British Columbia.&#160;&#160;The most northerly ice-free shipping port in North America, in Stewart, is accessible to store and ship concentrates.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	A high voltage, 138-kV transmission line currently services Stewart, BC and has sufficient capacity to provide power to the Brucejack Project.&#160;&#160;BC Hydro has started engineering work on a system upgrade to provide for the interconnection of the transmission line that will service the Brucejack Project with the 138kv transmission line servicing the town of Stewart.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	History and Exploration
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The exploration history of the area dates back to the 1880s when placer gold was located at Sulphurets and Mitchell Creeks.&#160;&#160;Placer mining was intermittently undertaken throughout the early 1900s and remained the main focus of prospecting until the mid-1930s.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In 1935, prospectors discovered copper-molybdenum mineralization on the Sulphurets property in the vicinity of the Main Copper zone, approximately six kilometres northwest of Brucejack Lake; however, these claims were not staked until 1960.&#160;&#160;From 1935 to 1959, the area was relatively inactive with respect to prospecting; however, it was intermittently evaluated by a number of different parties and several small copper and gold-silver occurrences were discovered in the Sulphurets-Mitchell Creek area.&#160;&#160;In 1960, Granduc and Alaskan prospectors staked the main claim group covering the known copper and gold-silver occurrences, which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	collectively became known as the Sulphurets property, starting the era of modern exploration.&#160;&#160;Various operators explored the area, and an underground program was completed on the West Zone between 1986 and 1991 by the Newcana Joint Venture among Granduc, Newhawk and Lacana Mining Corporation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	20
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage31"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In 1999, Silver Standard acquired Newhawk and with it, Newhawk's 60% interest and control of the Brucejack Project.&#160;&#160;In 2001, Silver Standard acquired Black Hawk&#8217;s 40% direct interest in the Brucejack Project, resulting in 100% interest in the Brucejack Project.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Silver Standard began initial work on the Brucejack Project in 2009 with drilling, rock-chip and channel sampling and re-sampling of historical drill core.&#160;&#160;The 2009 program tested five zones with 37 drillholes totalling 18,000 metres.&#160;&#160;A total of 12 drillholes were targeted at what would become the Valley of the Kings Zone (the &#8220;Valley of the Kings&#8221;).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In 2010, Silver Standard&#8217;s drill program was designed to continue definition of the bulk tonnage mineralization as well as to determine the nature and continuity of the high-grade mineralization observed at Valley of the Kings.&#160;&#160;Approximately one third of the 2010 drilling targeted the Valley of the Kings and included gold intersections of up to 5,840&#160;g/t gold.&#160;&#160;The bulk tonnage drilling achieved its intended goal through the definition of more than 20&#160;Moz at Brucejack (8&#160;Moz in Measured and Indicated and 12.5&#160;Moz gold in Inferred, at a 0.3&#160;g/t AuEq cut-off; Ghaffari et al. 2011).&#160;&#160;The relatively dense drilling from the bulk tonnage drilling program, with drill spacings of 100&#160;metres by 100&#160;metres to 50&#160;metres by 50&#160;metres, formed the basis upon which the bulk tonnage resource model was built.&#160;&#160;Numerous high-grade intersections were defined as part of this drilling, allowing for the initial delineation of high-grade mineralization trends.&#160;&#160;In 2010, Silver Standard proceeded with the sale of the Snowfield and Brucejack projects to us.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Our 2011&#160;diamond drill program was focused specifically on defining high grade resources.&#160;&#160;In 2011, 178&#160;drillholes were completed totalling 72,805&#160;metres in drillholes SU-110&#160;to SU-288.&#160;&#160;This included 97&#160;drillholes (41,219&#160;metres) that targeted the Valley of the Kings, 16&#160;drillholes (7,471&#160;metres) that targeted the West Zone, and 21&#160;drillholes (7,220&#160;metres) that targeted the surrounding areas. The remaining drilling was focused on expansion of Shore Zone, testing for structurally controlled high grade mineralization in Galena Hill (now part of the Valley of the Kings) and Bridge Zones, as well as testing new target areas.&#160;&#160;The West Zone ramp was partially dewatered in late 2011 and early 2012. A geotechnical mapping program and updated survey was completed on the dewatered portion of the mine.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Our 2012&#160;diamond drill program focused on defining the high grade resource for the Valley of the Kings, specifically targeting geological and structural features believed to be associated with high grade gold mineralization.&#160; Diamond drilling also focused on expanding the known extents of the Valley of the Kings Zone, both west of the Brucejack Fault and along trend to the east of the main mineralized zone.&#160;&#160; A total of 301&#160;drillholes were completed, totalling 105,500&#160;metres of drilling during the 2012&#160;drilling program.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	An underground exploration program commenced in 2012 which was designed to, amongst other things, access the Valley of the Kings deposit underground, excavate a 10,000 tonne
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	underground bulk sample and demonstrate continuity of the high-grade gold mineralization. The initial phase of the underground program involved widening a portion of the historical West Zone underground workings to five metres by five metres so that the historical West Zone portal and underground workings can be used for access to the Valley of the Kings with production sized mining equipment.&#160;&#160;In late December 2012, the widening of the historical West Zone underground workings was completed and excavation commenced of the access ramp from the West Zone workings to the Valley of the Kings.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	21
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage32"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Our 2013&#160;surface diamond drill program focused on further defining the high grade resource for the Valley of the Kings as well as the geological and structural features believed to be associated with gold mineralization.&#160;&#160;A total of 24&#160;surface diamond drillholes (5,200&#160;metres) of the 37&#160;surface drillholes (5,770&#160;metres; drillholes SU-590&#160;to SU-626) completed during the 2013&#160;drilling program were focussed on the Valley of the Kings.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In 2013,&#160;we also excavated a bulk sample from within the Valley of the Kings to further evaluate the geological interpretation and Mineral Resource estimate. The location of the proposed bulk sample was selected to be representative of the grade and character of the overall mineralization of the Valley of the Kings.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Underground development reached the bulk sample area in May 2013&#160;and underground drilling to support the bulk sample program began in mid-May. A total of 409&#160;drillholes (38,840&#160;metres) were completed with 200&#160;of these drillholes (16,640&#160;metres) testing the bulk sample area.&#160;&#160;The remainder (209&#160;drillholes totalling 22,200&#160;metres) were testing targets outside of the bulk sample area.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The design of the bulk sample was limited by provincial legislation to a maximum allowable bulk sample size of 10,000&#160;tonnes. The bulk sample was collected as a series of nominal 100&#160;tonne rounds in underground development. We elected to process the bulk sample both through a sample tower on site and at a custom mill (Contact Mill) in Montana, USA.&#160;&#160;The results of assaying of the samples from the sample tower provided, in Snowden&#8217;s opinion, an unacceptable degree of variation in the results.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In 2014, exploration focused on resource definition in the Valley of the Kings with both surface and underground exploration.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The 2014 surface drill program consisted of infill drilling, exploration drilling at depth and condemnation drilling.&#160;&#160;The infill drill program, comprising 5,818 metres in three holes including 14 wedge holes, was successful in confirming the grade and continuity of Indicated and Inferred gold mineralization in an area defined by the 2013 Mineral Resource estimate block model.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The exploration drilling at depth, which consisted of four deep drill holes comprising 3,507 metres, was successful in confirming the continuity of gold mineralization in the Valley of the Kings below the area defined by the 2013 Mineral Resource estimate.&#160;&#160;Condemnation drilling for mine site infrastructure consisted of 25 drill holes comprising 2,679 metres.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Underground exploration in the Valley of the Kings has continued to date with mapping and sampling coinciding with the advance of ramping and vent raise excavation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	22
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage33"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Geological Setting
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The Brucejack Property is located on the eastern limb of the broad McTagg anticlinorium, the northern closure of the Stewart-Iskut culmination.&#160;&#160;As a result, rocks on the Brucejack Property are tilted, as well as folded, and generally display a progressive younging towards the east.&#160;&#160;Volcanic arc-related rocks of the Triassic Stuhini Group form the core of the anticlinorium, and are successively replaced outwards by volcanic arc-related rocks of the Lower Jurassic Hazleton Group and clastic basin-fill sedimentary rocks of the Middle to Upper Jurassic Bowser Lake Group.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Geology on the Brucejack Property can generally be characterized as a northerly-trending, broadly arcuate, concave-westward structural-stratigraphic belt of variably altered rocks. This belt is bisected on the western side of the Brucejack Property by a prominent topographic lineament, the Brucejack Fault. This belt is characterised by a broad band of variably but generally intensely quartz-sericite-pyrite altered rocks of up to several hundred metres or more across, and approximately five kilometres in strike extent. The quartz-sericite-pyrite alteration typically contains between two and 20% pyrite, and, depending on the alteration intensity, can preclude protolith recognition. Most of the defined mineral resources on the Brucejack Property are located within the intensely altered zone.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Mineralization
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Gold (&#177; silver) mineralization is hosted in predominantly sub-vertical vein, vein stockwork, and subordinate vein breccia systems of variable intensity, throughout the alteration band.&#160;&#160;The stockwork systems display both parallel and discordant relationships to stratigraphy.&#160;&#160;The stockwork systems are relatively continuous along strike (several tens of metres to several hundreds of metres).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Several mineralization zones have been explored to varying degrees, including (from south to north): Bridge Zone, Valley of the Kings Zone, West Zone, Gossan Hill, Shore Zone, and SG Zone (Ireland et al. 2013).&#160;&#160;There are numerous relatively unexplored mineralization showings within the alteration band across the Brucejack Property that are between the main mineralization zones, highlighting the exceptional exploration potential of the Brucejack Property.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	High grade gold mineralization in the Valley of the Kings, the current focus of the Project, occurs in a series of west-northwest (and subordinate west-southwest) trending sub-vertical corridors of structurally reoriented vein stockworks and vein breccias.&#160;&#160;Stockwork mineralization displays both discordant and concordant relationships to the volcanic pile stratigraphy.&#160;&#160;Gold is typically present as gold-rich electrum within deformed quartz-carbonate (&#177;adularia?) vein stockworks, veins, and subordinate vein breccias, with grades ranging up to 41,582&#160;g/t gold and 27,725&#160;g/t silver over 0.5&#160;m.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Recent underground exploration carried out as a part of the bulk sample program confirmed the location of corridors of stockwork-style mineralization and the lithological contacts in this part of the deposit (within the Valley of the Kings).&#160;&#160;In addition the work resulted in the recognition of sub-vertical north-northeasterly trending deformed, curviplanar, and sheared quartz-carbonate veins containing abundant visible electrum.&#160;&#160;These structures are interpreted as structurally-controlled fluid conduits that were active during development of the porphyry system and associated volcanic pile in the early Jurassic, and which were reactivated during Cretaceous deformation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	23
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage34"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The Valley of the Kings deposit is currently defined over 1,200&#160;metres in east-west extent, 600&#160;metres in north-south extent, and 650&#160;metres in depth.&#160;&#160;The West Zone appears to form the northern limb of an anticline that links up with the Valley of the Kings in the south, and the southern limb of a syncline that extends further to the north.&#160;&#160;This zone, which is currently defined over 590&#160;metres along its northwest strike, 560&#160;metres across strike, and down to 650&#160;metres in depth, is open to the northwest, southeast, and at depth to the northeast.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Mineralized Zones
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The current resources as presented in this AIF are comprised of two different zones on the Brucejack Project, being the Valley of the Kings Zone and the West Zone.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Valley of the Kings Zone
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Exploration drilling by Silver Standard (2009, 2010) and the Company (2011 to present), as well as surface mapping, has been successful in outlining a series of corridors of high grade mineralization associated with deformed quartz stockworks and intense quartz-sericite-pyrite alteration in an east-west trending and east-southeast plunging tight syncline developed in almost the full sequence of lower Hazelton Group rocks.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The Valley of the Kings mineralized zone trends approximately west-northwest to east-southeast. Its orientation mirrors that of Electrum Ridge, a pronounced topographic feature near the southern margin of the zone, and drilling to date has extended its strike to over 800 metres. The zone is up to 150 metres wide and was originally thought to be bound to the west by the Brucejack Fault. Recent drilling in the current 2012 drill program, together with the presence of significant intervals of gold mineralization, in the Waterloo Zone, indicates that the Valley of the Kings continues west across the fault, thereby making the zone open to the west, as well as to the east and at depth.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	High-grade gold and silver mineralization within the Valley of the Kings occurs as electrum, which is generally hosted in deformed quartz-carbonate and quartz-adularia veins and vein stockworks. While quartz veining and stockworks are common throughout the zone, the majority of gold intersections are confined to corridors within a zone 75 metres to 100 metres wide on the southern limb of the syncline. The orientation of these corridors is subparallel to the fold axis. Gold to silver ratios within the Valley of the Kings are typically 2:1 or higher.&#160;&#160;Variations in this ratio, which could be a function of thermal gradients developed at the time of mineralization, are suggested by a visible increase in the proportion of silvery electrum (at the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	expense of more gold-coloured electrum) with a concomitant increase in the proportion of vein-hosted adularia towards the eastern parts of the zone. Additional precious metals-bearing minerals found in the Valley of the Kings, typically in trace quantities, include silver sulphides, acanthite, pyrargyrite and tetrahedrite, and associated with base metal-bearing sulphides include sphalerite and galena.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	24
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage35"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Low grade bulk tonnage mineralization, associated with disseminated anhedral pyrite, forms a halo within the altered rocks, surrounding the high grade mineralization corridors.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	West Zone
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The West Zone gold-silver deposit is hosted by a northwesterly trending band of intensely altered Lower Jurassic latitic to trachyandesitic volcanic and subordinate sedimentary rocks, as much as 400 metres to 500 metres thick, which passes between two more competent bodies of hornblende plagioclase hornblende phyric flows. The stratified rocks dip moderately to steeply to the northeast and are intensely altered, particularly in the immediate area of the precious metals mineralization. The West Zone appears to form the northern limb of an anticline that links up with the Valley of the Kings to the south, and the southern limb of a syncline that extends further to the north.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The West Zone deposit itself comprises at least 10 quartz veins and mineralized quartz stockwork ore shoots, the longest of which has a strike length of approximately 250 metres and a maximum thickness of about around 6 metres. Most mineralized shoots have vertical extents that are greater than their strike lengths. Veins and stockworks in this zone display clear evidence of post-mineral ductile and brittle deformation. The West Zone is open along strike to the southeast, and at depth to the northeast.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In terms of hydrothermal alteration, the West Zone is marked by a central silicified zone that passes outwards to a zone of sericite &#177; quartz &#177; carbonate and then an outer zone of chlorite &#177; sericite &#177; carbonate. The combined thickness of the alteration zones across the central part of the deposit is between 100 metres and 150 metres.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Gold in the West Zone occurs principally as electrum in quartz veins and is associated with, in decreasing order of abundance, pyrite, sphalerite, chalcopyrite, and galena. Besides being found with gold in electrum, silver occurs in tetrahedrite, pyrargyrite, polybasite and, rarely, stephanite and acanthite. Gangue mineralogy of the veins is dominated by quartz, with accessory adularia, albite, sericite, and minor carbonate and barite. The increased abundance of silver in the West Zone may suggest that this zone was formed down temperature gradient from the Valley of the Kings.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Drilling
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The input data for the West Zone Mineral Resource estimate consisted of 756&#160;drillholes (63,208&#160;metres) including 439&#160;underground drillholes (24,688&#160;metres), 269&#160;historical surface drillholes (21,321&#160; metres) and 48&#160;surface drillholes (17,199 metres) completed since 2009.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The input data for the Valley of the Kings Mineral Resource estimate comprised 932 drillholes totalling 218,238&#160;metres. The drilling consisted of:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	9 historic drillholes (579&#160;metres);
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	490 surface drillholes drilled between 2009 and 2012 (173,619&#160;metres);
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	24 surface drillholes drilled in 2013 (5,200&#160;metres); and
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	25
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage36"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	409 underground drillholes drilled in 2013 (38,840&#160;metres).
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Drillhole paths were surveyed at a nominal 50 metre interval using a Reflex EZ single shot instrument. There was no apparent drilling or recovery factor that would materially impact the accuracy and reliability of the drilling results.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The drill collars were surveyed by McElhanney Surveying from Terrace, BC. McElhanney Surveying used a total station instrument and permanent ground control stations for reference and have completed all the surveying on the project since 2009. All underground drill collars were surveyed by Procon.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Historical drill core sizes for surface drillholes were NQ (47.6 millimetre diameter) and BQ (36.5 millimetre diameter). Core size for drillholes collared from an underground exploration ramp at West Zone was AQ (27 millimetre diameter).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Core sizes for our surface collared drillholes are PQ (85 millimetre diameter), HQ (63.5 millimetre diameter) and NQ (47.6 millimetre diameter). Approximately 50% to 60% of the Company&#8217;s core is HQ size.&#160;&#160;All drillcore collected from the underground drilling in 2013 was HQ size.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Sampling, Analysis, Data Verification and Security
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Split PQ samples weigh approximately 10 kilograms. HQ samples are around 6 kilograms, and NQ are 3 kilograms to 4 kilograms. These weights assume a nominal 1.5 metre sample length. In general, the average sample size submitted to the analytical laboratory, ALS Chemex (&#8220;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	ALS
</FONT>
	&#8221;) was 6.5 kilograms.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Samples at ALS were crushed to 70% passing 2 millimetres, (-10 mesh). Samples
</FONT>
	were riffle split and 500 g were pulverized to 85% passing 75 &#956;m (-200 mesh). The remaining coarse reject material was returned to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	us for storage in our Stewart warehouse.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Gold was determined using fire assay on a 30 g aliquot with an atomic absorption finish. In addition, a 33 element package was completed using a four acid digest and ICP-AES analysis, which included the silver. Density determinations were done by ALS using the pycnometer method on pulps from the drilling program.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Snowden analysed the quality assurance and quality control (&#8220;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	QAQC
</FONT>
	&#8221;) for the Brucejack Project.&#160;&#160;The Brucejack drillhole and QAQC database is managed by GeoSpark Consulting Inc. (&#8220;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	GeoSpark
</FONT>
	&#8221;), who also manage the routine analysis of the QAQC results for the Company.&#160;&#160;GeoSpark supplied Snowden with a QAQC database, in Microsoft Access format, containing the QAQC results for all drilling up to 5 December 2013.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The QAQC protocols included the use of field duplicates, standards and blanks.&#160;&#160;The quality control samples were included at a nominal rate of one field duplicate, one standard and one blank for every 20 samples.&#160;&#160;&#160;Check assays, in the form of pulp duplicates, were also completed by a different laboratory and compared with the primary laboratory.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	26
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage37"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Procedures undertaken by the Company have been under the supervision and security of our staff, as far as drill core sampling prior to dispatch. Laboratory sample reduction and analytical procedures have been conducted by independent accredited companies with acceptable practices.&#160;&#160;We ensure quality control is monitored through the insertion of blanks, certified reference materials and duplicates.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Mineral Processing and Metallurgical Testing
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Several metallurgical test programs were carried out to investigate the metallurgical performance of the mineralization. The main test work was completed from 2009 to early 2014. The samples tested were generated from various drilling programs, including the samples tested by the bulk sample processing programs. The metallurgical test programs conducted on the Brucejack mineralization included head sample characteristics, gravity concentration, gold/silver bulk flotation, cyanidation, table concentrate melting and the determination of various process related parameters. The early test work focused on developing the flowsheet for gravity concentration, bulk flotation, and flotation concentrate cyanidation. The test work also studied the metallurgical responses of the samples to the gravity concentration flowsheet for gravity concentration followed by whole ore leaching. The later test work concentrated on the gravity-flotation concentration flowsheet.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In general, the Valley of the Kings Zone and West Zone mineralization is moderately hard. The mineral samples tested responded well to the conventional combined gravity and flotation flowsheet. The gold in the mineralization was amenable to centrifugal gravity concentration. On average, 40 to 50% of the gold in the samples were recovered by the gravity concentration. The flotation tests results indicated that bulk flotation can effectively recover the gold remained in the gravity concentration tailings using potassium amyl xanthate as a collector at the natural pH. Two stages of cleaner flotation would significantly upgrade rougher flotation concentrate. The gold in the mineralization showed better metallurgical performance, compared to silver. On average, approximately 96 to 97% of the gold and 91 to 92% of the silver were recovered to the gravity concentrate and bulk flotation concentrate at the grind size of 80% passing approximately 70 to 80&#160;&#181;m. There was a significant variation in metallurgical performances among the samples tested. This may be a result of the nugget gold effect. The industrial runs on the 10,000-t bulk sample for the 2013 bulk sample processing program and the 1,200-t high-grade Cleo mineralization conducted in 2014 showed that the gravity/flotation process flowsheet as designed for the Brucejack mineralization suited the treatment of the bulk sample. The results also showed that the gravity/flotation flowsheet adapted well for the varying mineralization and the wide range feed grades that were experienced during processing of the bulk sample.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Cyanide leach tests were also conducted to investigate the gold and silver extractions from various samples, including head samples, flotation concentrates, flotation tailings and gravity
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	concentrates. In general, most of the sample responded reasonably well to direct cyanidation, excluding a few of samples containing higher contents of graphite (carbon), arsenic, or electrum. Cyanide leach process was not recommended for the feasibility study.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	27
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage38"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The test results suggest that the gold and silver recovery flowsheet for the mineralization should include gravity concentration, bulk rougher and scavenger flotation, rougher and scavenger concentrate regrinding, followed by cleaner flotation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Mineral Processing
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The process flowsheet developed for the Brucejack Property mineralization is a combination of conventional bulk sulphide flotation and gravity concentration to recover gold and silver. The processing plant will produce a gold-silver bearing flotation concentrate and gold-silver dor&#233; that will be produced by melting the gravity concentrate produced from the gravity concentration circuits. Based on the LOM average, the recovery process is estimated to produce approximately 5,600&#160;kg of gold and 1,900&#160;kg of silver as dor&#233; per year and 44,000&#160;t of gold-silver bearing flotation concentrate per year from the mill feed, grading 14.1&#160;g/t gold and 57.7&#160;g/t silver. The estimated gold recoveries to the dor&#233; and flotation concentrate are 43.3% and 53.4%, respectively, totalling 96.7%. The estimated silver recoveries reporting to the dor&#233; and flotation concentrate are 3.5% and 86.5%, respectively, totalling 90.0%. The LOM average gold and silver contents of the flotation concentrate are anticipated to be approximately 157&#160;g/t gold and 1,000&#160;g/t silver. The flotation concentrate will be shipped off site to a smelter for further treatment to recover the gold and silver.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The process plant will consist of:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	one stage of crushing (located underground);
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	a surge bin with a live capacity of 2,500&#160;t on surface;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	a semi-autogeneous grinding (SAG) mill and ball mill primary grinding circuit integrated with gravity concentration;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	rougher flotation and rougher/scavenger flotation followed by rougher flotation concentrate regrinding; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	cleaner flotation processes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	A gravity concentration circuit will also be incorporated in the bulk concentrate regrinding circuit.
